author: James Andrews
title: Tesco scraps free click and collect for millions – how to get round it
text:
Money Tesco scraps free click and collect for millions – how to get round it Customers are outraged – and considering switching stores – after Tesco changed the rules on Click and Collect. This is how you can still pick up your shopping free Share What would you pay for someone to pack your shopping for you? (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get money updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It saved you time, and possibly money too. Simply order your food online, then pop into your nearest Tesco on the way home to pick up your shopping. 
But now the supermarket giant is charging people for the privilege of picking up their own shopping in store. 
Next Day Click and Collect is now priced between £0 and £2 , there are still some free slots available, same Day Click and Collect is available Monday to Saturday and priced between £2 and £4. Read More Barmy online supermarket substitutions are leaving shoppers utterly baffled 
“The changes we are making to Click and Collect better reflect the lengths our colleagues go to picking and packing orders for our customers,” a Tesco spokeswoman told Mirror Money. 
“We continue to offer a number of free next day Click + Collect slots, as well as home delivery slots from as little as £1. Next day Click and Collect slots remain free for members of our Delivery Saver scheme.” Read More
